DOC.brief_summary: Randomized controlled trial assessing the safety and benefits of shortening preoperative fasts on intubated ICU patients undergoing tracheotomy.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients undergoing bedside tracheotomy in an ICU are enrolled and randomized into two groups. Arm A receive a standard fast of at least 6 hours. Arm B receive a shortened fast of only 45 minutes, just before the surgery begins. We monitor these patients for aspiration, pneumonia and our ability to delivery better nutrition as a result of the intervention.
DOC.criteria: intubated ICU patient undergoing tracheotomy, receiving enteral nutrition, adult, proxy available for consent pregnant, <18yo, cannot tolerate enteral feeding
